availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Thompson McConnell in Woodford County, Kentucky, on May 23, 1848. Father of Eliza McConnell, Martha McConnell, Willie McConnell, Robert McConnell, James McConnell, and Lizzie McConnell. Farmer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned twenty-eight enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1, p. 675.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 524A-B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320, p. 120.
"Robert McConnell (1817-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial #195895543, accessed September 27, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/195895543.
